body_html: @adonisues Yes, I am aware of the weight shapes. The doubled weight sizes look like type 2, but it is actually just type 1 when using cudnn. It is difficult to generally determine whether the lstm is using cudnn path or not, but fortunately we see from here(https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/_functions/rnn.py#L300) that it just needs to know if the input is cudnn_acceptable or not. However, be careful that this condition is subject to change in future versions.
